meanings.sent1: The old shed looked even grottier after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The alley behind the restaurant was much grottier than the main street.
meanings.sent3: The grottier the socks, the more the dog seemed to enjoy them as toys.
meanings.sent4: Her mood grew grottier as the day went on, like a dark cloud looming.
meanings.sent5: The grottier the water in the pond, the fewer ducks were swimming in it.

meanings.definition: in a worse condition than something else
meanings.sent1: The older model of the car was grottier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: His attitude became grottier as the competition intensified.
meanings.sent3: The grottier the joke, the harder his friends laughed at it.
meanings.sent4: The grottier the road, the more adventurous the travelers felt.
meanings.sent5: The grottier the weather, the more people stayed indoors.
